DefinedConstants.Description: Maximum string length for a directory/path setting
DefinedConstants.Name: MaxPathStrLen

DefinedConstants.Description: Maximum string length for a filename setting
DefinedConstants.Name: MaxFileNameStrLen

DefinedConstants.Description: Maximum string length for a miscellaneous string setting
DefinedConstants.Name: MaxMiscStrLen

Structure.Description: Enables debug print messages in the Info category [DbgPrintCatInfoMsg].
Structure.Name: InfoEnabled

Structure.Description: Enables debug print messages in the Warning category [DbgPrintCatWarnMsg].
Structure.Name: WarningEnabled

Structure.Description: Enables debug print messages in the Error category [DbgPrintCatErrorMsg].
Structure.Name: ErrorEnabled

Structure.Description: Enables debug print messages in the SC category [DbgPrintCatScMsg].
Structure.Name: ScEnabled

Structure.Description: Enables debug print messages in the Event Print category [DbgPrintCatEventPrintMsg].
Structure.Name: EventPrintEnabled

Structure.Description: Enables debug print messages in the Event Print Callback category [DbgPrintCatEventPrintCallbackMsg].
Structure.Name: EventPrintCbEnabled

Structure.Description: Writes debug overlay information to the screen.
Structure.Name: VisualConfirmEnabled

Structure.Description: Draws the timegraph to the screen.
Structure.Name: TimeGraphEnabled

Structure.Description: Location to display debug text.
Structure.Name: DebugOverlayLocation

Structure.Description: Information about the client performing the rendering. For example: Rendered By PAL (0.0.1)
Structure.Name: RenderedByString

Structure.Description: Debug information that the client or tester might want reported.
Structure.Name: MiscellaneousDebugString

Structure.Description: Output current frame number in the debug overlay.
Structure.Name: PrintFrameNumber

Settings.Description: Controls what information is displayed on the Debug Overlay.
Settings.Name: DebugOverlayConfig

Structure.Description: Color of the grid line in the time graph.
Structure.Name: GridLineColor

Structure.Description: Color of the CPU line in the time graph.
Structure.Name: CpuLineColor

Structure.Description: Color of the GPU line in the time graph.
Structure.Name: GpuLineColor

Structure.Description: End benchmark after specified number of seconds.  The benchmark can still be ended early by hitting F11.  A value of 0 will allow the benchmark to run forever.
Structure.Name: MaxBenchmarkTime

Structure.Description: Whether or not a log entry of PAL usage will be generated to disk.
Structure.Name: UsageLogEnable

Structure.Description: Relative directory where usage logs are placed. Relative to the path in the AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable. If that env var isn't set, the location is platform dependent.
Structure.Name: UsageLogDirectory

Structure.Description: Filename and extension of the usage log.
Structure.Name: UsageLogFilename

Structure.Description: Log frame time and average FPS during benchmark session to files. Only enabled when DebugVisualDisplay is enabled.
Structure.Name: LogFrameStats

Structure.Description: Relative directory where frame statistic logs are placed. Relative to the path in the AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable. If that env var isn't set, the location is platform dependent.
Structure.Name: FrameStatsLogDirectory

Structure.Description: Max mumber of frame time samples that can be logged in a benchmark session.
Structure.Name: MaxLoggedFrames

Structure.Description: If the total memory allocated from the two non-local heaps should be shown in a single line.
Structure.Name: CombineNonLocal

Structure.Description: Determines if the overlay will report information about CmdAllocator allocations.
Structure.Name: ReportCmdAllocator

Structure.Description: Determines if the overlay will report information about external allocations.
Structure.Name: ReportExternal

Structure.Description: Determines if the overlay will report information about internal allocations.
Structure.Name: ReportInternal

Settings.Description: Configures the memory usage display on the Debug Overlay.
Settings.Name: OverlayMemoryInfoConfig

Settings.Description: Enables and sets the SQTT mode for the GPU performance profiler layer.  Actual capture of performance data must be specified via frame number with GpuProfilerConfig.StartFrame or by holding shift-F11.
Settings.Name: GpuProfilerMode

Values.Description: Traces are disabled but perf counter and timing operations are enabled.
Values.Name: GpuProfilerCounterAndTimingOnly

Values.Description: Traces (Spm and/or Sqtt) are output in format (.csv, .out) for Thread trace viewer.
Values.Name: GpuProfilerTraceEnabledTtv

Values.Description: Trace data (Spm and/or Sqtt) is output as .rgp file for Radeon Gpu Profiler.
Values.Name: GpuProfilerTraceEnabledRgp

Structure.Description: Relative directory where GPU profiler logs are written. Relative to the path in the AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable. If that env var isn't set, the location is platform dependent.
Structure.Name: LogDirectory

Structure.Description: Frame number to begin performance data collection. Currently Gpu Profiler doesn't support profiling frame 0
Structure.Name: StartFrame

Structure.Description: Number of frames to enable performance data collection.
Structure.Name: FrameCount

Structure.Description: Enable recording of pipeline stats for each operation on the compute or universal queue. Enabling this may adversely affect quality of the GPU timing data.  Not supported for frame-granularity captures.
Structure.Name: RecordPipelineStats

Structure.Description: Split up IQueue::Submit() calls so that the PAL core is called once per command buffer in the batch.  This can significantly reduce the GPU memory overhead of the profiler, but may have a slight impact on results.
Structure.Name: BreakSubmitBatches

Structure.Description: Mask indicating which traces are enabled. Both spm trace and Sqtt trace are disabled (0x0)   Spm trace is enabled (0x1). Sqtt trace is enabled (0x2).
Structure.Name: TraceModeMask

Settings.Description: Configuration options for the PAL GPU Profiler layer.
Settings.Name: GpuProfilerConfig

Structure.Description: File path specifying where the global performance counter config file can be found.  This file should have one line per counter to capture in the form "Block ID Instance Name". Block can be one of the following: CB, CPC, CPF, CPG, DB, DMA, GDS, GRBM, GRBM_SE, IA, MC, PA, RLC, SC, SPI, SQ, SRBM, SX, TA, TCA, TCC, TCP, TCS, TD, VGT, WD. ID should correspond to the specific counter of interest for the specified Block, these can be selected by reading the performance counter select register for that block. Instance can be the block instance ordinal of interest. It can also be the enum EACH which means every instance of the block is of interest. Also It can be ALL, which has the same meaning as EACH, but the results of every instance will be accumlated. Name will be the header of the column in the .csv file (limited to 127 characters).  A "#" can be inserted as the first character in a line to force that line to be ignored.  Gathering performance counters has a huge performance impact; consider disabling TDRs on Windows.
Structure.Name: GlobalPerfCounterConfigFile

Structure.Description: Insert cache flush and invalidate events before and after every range of commands where performance counters are collected.
Structure.Name: CacheFlushOnCounterCollection

Structure.Description: Determines what granularity should be used for gathering performance data:  0: Per draw.  Each separate draw will be measured. 1: Per command buffer.  Whole command buffers will be grouped. 2: Per frame.  Whole frame will be grouped.  Useful to get a thread trace covering all command buffers across the universal and compute queues.  Pipeline stats cannot be gathered in this mode.  If you wish to gather a thread trace across multiple queues (i.e., including async compute work), you should also set requestDebugVmid.

Values.Description: Per draw.  Each separate draw will be measured.
Values.Name: GpuProfilerGranularityDraw

Values.Description: Per command buffer.  Whole command buffers will be grouped.
Values.Name: GpuProfilerGranularityCmdBuf

Values.Description: Per frame, the whole frame will be grouped.  Useful to get a thread trace covering all command buffers across the universal and compute queues.  Pipeline stats will not be gathered in this mode.  NOTE: Since SQTT will be filtered by VMID if you wish to gather a thread trace across multiple queues (i.e., including async compute work), a Debug VMID should also be requested to ensure work in all queues share the same VMID.
Values.Name: GpuProfilerGranularityFrame

Structure.Name: Granularity

Settings.Description: Configuration options for performance counter collection through the PAL GPU Profiler Layer.
Settings.Name: GpuProfilerPerfCounterConfig

Structure.Description: Mask indicating which SQTT tokens should be included in the trace.  Value will be written to TOKEN_MASK field in hardware.  For reference, based on GFX8 SQTT user guide: 0x0001: TIME (TT2.0 only), MISC (TT2.1+) 0x0002: TIMESTAMP 0x0004: REG 0x0008: WAVE_START 0x0010: WAVE_PS_ALLOC (TT2.0 only) / WAVE_ALLOC (TT2.1+) 0x0020: WAVE_VS_ALLOC (TT2.0 only) / REG_CSPRIV (TT2.1+) 0x0040: WAVE_END 0x0080: EVENT 0x0100: EVENT_CS 0x0200: EVENT_GFX1 0x0400: INST 0x0800: INST_PC 0x1000: INST_USERDATA 0x2000: ISSUE 0x4000: PERF 0x8000: MISC (TT2.0 only), REG_CS(TT2.1+)
Structure.Name: TokenMask

Structure.Description: Mask indicating which which SE to gather thread trace from.
Structure.Name: SEMask

Structure.Description: Pipeline compiler hash to enable SQ thread traces for. If this is zero, thread traces will be enabled for all pipelines.  This filtering only applies to draw or cmdbuf profiling granularity.
Structure.Name: PipelineHash

Structure.Description: High QWORD of the VS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: VsHashHi

Structure.Description: Low QWORD of the VS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: VsHashLo

Structure.Description: High QWORD of the HS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: HsHashHi

Structure.Description: Low QWORD of the HS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: HsHashLo

Structure.Description: High QWORD of the DS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: DsHashHi

Structure.Description: Low QWORD of the DS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: DsHashLo

Structure.Description: High QWORD of the GS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: GsHashHi

Structure.Description: Low QWORD of the GS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: GsHashLo

Structure.Description: High QWORD of the PS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: PsHashHi

Structure.Description: Low QWORD of the PS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: PsHashLo

Structure.Description: High QWORD of the CS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: CsHashHi

Structure.Description: Low QWORD of the CS hash to enable SQ thread traces for.
Structure.Name: CsHashLo

Structure.Description: Max number of draws to thread-trace.  A value of 0 indicates no limit.
Structure.Name: MaxDraws

Structure.Description: Whether to inject the pipeline hash and client shader hases into the thread trace for Thread Trace Viewer analysis.
Structure.Name: AddTtvHashes

Structure.Description: Maximum amount of data in bytes to capture per trace.  A trace will cover a span of commands based on the GpuProfilerGranularity setting.  Defaults to 1MB.  Current HW requires the size be aligned to 0x1000 bytes.
Structure.Name: BufferSize

Structure.Description: Behavior to take when trace buffer is full.

Values.Description: Lose detailed profiling data when necessary to attempt to avoid stalls
Values.Name: GpuProfilerStallLoseDetail

Values.Description: Never stall, discard data if the buffer is full
Values.Name: GpuProfilerStallNever

Structure.Name: StallBehavior

Settings.Description: Configuration options for capturing a SQ Thread Trace through the PAL GPU Profiler layer.
Settings.Name: GpuProfilerSqttConfig

Structure.Description: File path specifying where the global performance counter config file can be found.  This file should have one line per counter to capture in the form "Block ID Instance Name". Block can be one of the following: CB, CPC, CPF, CPG, DB, DMA, GDS, GRBM, GRBM_SE, IA, MC, PA, RLC, SC, SPI, SQ, SRBM, SX, TA, TCA, TCC, TCP, TCS, TD, VGT, WD.  ID should correspond counter of interest for the specified Block, these can be selected by reading the performance to the specific counter select register for that block. Instance can be the block instance ordinal of interest. It can also be the enum EACH which means every instance of the block is of interest. Also It can be ALL, which has the same meaning as EACH, but the results of every instance will be accumlated. Name will be the header of the column in the .csv file (limited to 127 characters).  A "#" can be inserted as the first character in a line to force that line to be ignored.  Gathering performance counters has a huge performance impact; consider disabling TDRs on Windows. WARNING: Page fault will occur when attempting spm traces on GFX9 HW, unless RLC_SPM_VMID is set in the RLC_SPM_MC_CNTL register. KMD has to set this register. This register can be set manually (debug VMID: 0xb, RequestDebugVmid=true) for testing. Also, the sample delay register values need to be set for correct streaming counter data.
Structure.Name: SpmPerfCounterConfigFile

Structure.Description: Sample interval in sclck.
Structure.Name: SpmTraceInterval

Structure.Description: Maximum amount of data in bytes to capture per trace.  A trace will cover a span of commands based on the GpuProfilerGranularity setting.  Defaults to 1MB.  Current HW requires the size be aligned to 0x1000 bytes.
Structure.Name: SpmBufferSize

Settings.Description: Configuration options for capturing Streaming Performance Monitors through the PAL GPU Profiler layer.
Settings.Name: GpuProfilerSpmConfig

Settings.Description: Enables the command buffer logger layer, which provides ICmdBuffer level annotations directly in command buffer dumps. These annoations can later be deciphered using offline tools.
Settings.Name: CmdBufferLoggerEnabled

Settings.Description: Bitmask controlling which ICmdBuffer calls to annotate
Settings.Name: CmdBufferLoggerFlags

Settings.Description: Enables the PAL interface logging layer.
Settings.Name: InterfaceLoggerEnabled

Structure.Description: Relative directory where the interface logger writes its logs. Relative to the path in the AMD_DEBUG_DIR environment variable. If that env var isn't set, the location is platform dependent.
Structure.Name: LogDirectory

Structure.Description: Each thread will write into its own log file, avoiding taking a global lock.
Structure.Name: Multithreaded

Structure.Description: Bitmask of which interface function calls will be logged by default.

Values.Description: LogFlagGeneralCalls: Functions which are hard to classify or rarely called.
LogFlagCreateDestroy: Functions which create and destroy PAL objects.
LogFlagBindGpuMemory: Functions relevant to GPU memory binding.
LogFlagQueueOps: Functions relevant to IQueue operations.
LogFlagCmdBuilding: Functions which build ICmdBuffer commands.

Structure.Name: BasePreset

Structure.Description: Bitmask of which interface function calls will be logged when the user holds Shift-F11

Values.Description: LogFlagGeneralCalls: Functions which are hard to classify or rarely called.
LogFlagCreateDestroy: Functions which create and destroy PAL objects.
LogFlagBindGpuMemory: Functions relevant to GPU memory binding.
LogFlagQueueOps: Functions relevant to IQueue operations.
LogFlagCmdBuilding: Functions which build ICmdBuffer commands.

Structure.Name: ElevatedPreset

Settings.Description: Configuration options for the PAL Interface Logger layer.
Settings.Name: InterfaceLoggerConfig
